data.message: Smart and simple, I achieve similar grouping using the TestGroup attribute in Nunit so I can group related cases together, but this approach in the Phill Haack blog is better
I do like this approach but some people consider it bad as you now have nested classes in your test and I know that they are right in this point but it makes organizing related tests very easy

Well if you don't use CTRL+M CTRL+O it kindda makes the code hard to read specially that 

most people (at least the people i know) expect one class per file and that's why I 

think using public nested claases is not good approache because if you are gonna make 

public why don't you make it in a seperate file?. But in the testing scenario once you 

get used to it. It's nice

I don't finding that confusing. To me it's the same as using regions but it has the extra benefits of 
1) Grouping of related tests
2) Shorter test names
